title: Add LottieView.setMinAndMaxFrame(startMarkerName: String, endMarkerName: String)
body:
** If you don't use this template, your issue will be closed **

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Our iOS boys have the ability to specify two marker names to animate between.  This is useful because our animation markers do not have durations set on them.
```
animationView?.play(fromMarker: MarkerNames.loopStart,
                            toMarker: MarkerNames.loopEnd,
                            loopMode: .loop,
                            completion: nil)
```
We don't have a direct equivalent in Android land.  We can't use `setMinAndMaxFrame(loopStartMarkerName)` because the marker does not have a duration.  We can't use `setMinFrame(loopStartMarkerName)` with `setMaxFrame(loopEndMarkerName)` because an exception will be thrown if done out of order (for instance if changing from 0-100 to 101-200, if we setMinFrame first, it will error out because 101-100 is not a valid range).

**Describe the solution you'd like**
API parity with iOS via adding a `setMinAndMaxFrame(startmarkerName: String, startmarkerName: String)` method to LottieView, and any other places that make sense (eg LottieDrawable)

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Currently we're working around it with this:
```
val composition = lottieView.composition!!
lottieView.setMinAndMaxFrame(
    composition.getMarker(loopStartMarkerName)!!.startFrame.toInt(),
    (composition.getMarker(loopEndMarkerName)!!.startFrame + 0.99f).toInt()
)
```
Cumbersome, non-discoverable, doesn't work if composition not available yet, maybe some other issues

**Additional context**
Love your work!
